definition: to be on the verge of saying what is on one's mind
dialect/language/spoken words/speech/talk/words/conversation/what sb said/CL:種|种[zhong3],席[xi2],句[ju4],口[kou3],番[fan1]
to (a place)/until (a time)/up to/to go/to arrive/(verb complement denoting completion or result of an action)
suffix of a noun of locality
A still tongue makes a wise head. (idiom)
pinyin: hua4 dao4 zui3 bian1 liu2 san1 fen1

sentences.english: Think good words to the mouth side, speak hesitatingly again.
sentences.chinese: 想好的話到嘴邊處，又吞吞吐吐。

sentences.english: She wanted to tell him her real feelings, but she bit the words back.
sentences.chinese: 她本想告訴他真情，話到嘴邊又咽了回去。

sentences.english: The questions rose to my throat but I could not ask them, unprepared for any answers.
sentences.chinese: 話到嘴邊又咽下去了，我對任何回答都沒有心理準備。
